column1: Relation between tannic wine and food
column2: Reduce the feeling of sweet of the food; Seems sweeter and softer with a dish full of proteines such as meat; Seems less bitter but more tannic with salty dishes; Seems dry with spicy food

column1: Relation between sweet wine and  food
column2: Seems less sweet with salty food; Makes salty dishes more enjoyable; Goes well with sweet food if they are themself acid enough; Can make sweet dish too sweet

column1: Relation between acid wine and food
column2: Seems less acid with salty food; Seems less acid with slightly sweet food; Can make feel salty food more salty; Can balance too fatty dishes

column1: Relation between strong wine (with a lot of alcohol) and food
column2: Can hide subtil flavours of dishes; Goes well with slightly sweet dishes

column1: Wine with a strong alcohol level
column2: Crusty or chewy meals, not liquid

column1: Wine with a lot of tannin
column2: Consistent or fatty dish, red meat is a good fit

Madère Sercial or xérès amontillado sec
Avoid sweet desserts, better go for desserts with a bit of acidity with agrums, mango, pineapple, or apricot, or with a blue cheese like roquefort

column1: Old wine with tannin leaving with age
column2: Meat in a casserole, confit or pulled

column1: Creative dishes with mousse or gelée
Dish with a lot of lemon

column2: Not a tannic wine, better a white or a rosé
Better go for water instead of wine

Good for aperitif, Oriental dishes with river fishes or foie gras
